EdgeCaseAnnotations.ZeroInput: If input is zero, count will become zero, which may or may not be intended.
EdgeCaseAnnotations.HighInputOverflow: If input is high enough to cause an overflow, count will contain an incorrect, reduced value due to overflow.

CommonAttackPatterns.ArithmeticOverflow: Without overflow protection, an attacker can manipulate the count value by triggering an overflow, possibly leading to unexpected contract states.

RecoveryMechanisms.None: This contract does not have mechanisms to recover from or prevent overflow, nor does it contain emergency stop features.
